11#include "common_video/include/video_frame_buffer_pool.h"
12
13#include <limits>
14
15#include "rtc_base/checks.h"
16
17namespace webrtc {
18
19namespace {
20bool HasOneRef(const rtc::scoped_refptr<VideoFrameBuffer>& buffer) {
21 // Cast to rtc::RefCountedObject is safe because this function is only called
22 // on locally created VideoFrameBuffers, which are either
23 // |rtc::RefCountedObject<I420Buffer>| or |rtc::RefCountedObject<NV12Buffer>|.
24 switch (buffer->type()) {
25 case VideoFrameBuffer::Type::kI420: {
26 return static_cast<rtc::RefCountedObject<I420Buffer>*>(buffer.get())
27 ->HasOneRef();
28 }
29 case VideoFrameBuffer::Type::kNV12: {
30 return static_cast<rtc::RefCountedObject<NV12Buffer>*>(buffer.get())
31 ->HasOneRef();
32 }
33 default:
34 RTC_NOTREACHED();
35 }
36 return false;
37}
38
39} // namespace
40
41VideoFrameBufferPool::VideoFrameBufferPool() : VideoFrameBufferPool(false) {}
42
43VideoFrameBufferPool::VideoFrameBufferPool(bool zero_initialize)
44 : VideoFrameBufferPool(zero_initialize,
45 std::numeric_limits<size_t>::max()) {}
46
47VideoFrameBufferPool::VideoFrameBufferPool(bool zero_initialize,
48 size_t max_number_of_buffers)
49 : zero_initialize_(zero_initialize),
50 max_number_of_buffers_(max_number_of_buffers) {}
51
52VideoFrameBufferPool::~VideoFrameBufferPool() = default;
53
54void VideoFrameBufferPool::Release() {
55 buffers_.clear();
56}
57
58bool VideoFrameBufferPool::Resize(size_t max_number_of_buffers) {
59 RTC_DCHECK_RUNS_SERIALIZED(&race_checker_);
60 size_t used_buffers_count = 0;
61 for (const rtc::scoped_refptr<VideoFrameBuffer>& buffer : buffers_) {
62 // If the buffer is in use, the ref count will be >= 2, one from the list we
63 // are looping over and one from the application. If the ref count is 1,
64 // then the list we are looping over holds the only reference and it's safe
65 // to reuse.
66 if (!HasOneRef(buffer)) {
67 used_buffers_count++;
68 }
69 }
70 if (used_buffers_count > max_number_of_buffers) {
71 return false;
72 }
73 max_number_of_buffers_ = max_number_of_buffers;
74
75 size_t buffers_to_purge = buffers_.size() - max_number_of_buffers_;
76 auto iter = buffers_.begin();
77 while (iter != buffers_.end() && buffers_to_purge > 0) {
78 if (HasOneRef(*iter)) {
79 iter = buffers_.erase(iter);
80 buffers_to_purge--;
81 } else {
82 ++iter;
83 }
84 }
85 return true;
86}
87
88rtc::scoped_refptr<I420Buffer> VideoFrameBufferPool::CreateI420Buffer(
89 int width,
90 int height) {
91 RTC_DCHECK_RUNS_SERIALIZED(&race_checker_);
92
93 rtc::scoped_refptr<VideoFrameBuffer> existing_buffer =
94 GetExistingBuffer(width, height, VideoFrameBuffer::Type::kI420);
95 if (existing_buffer) {
96 // Cast is safe because the only way kI420 buffer is created is
97 // in the same function below, where |RefCountedObject<I420Buffer>| is
98 // created.
99 rtc::RefCountedObject<I420Buffer>* raw_buffer =
100 static_cast<rtc::RefCountedObject<I420Buffer>*>(existing_buffer.get());
101 // Creates a new scoped_refptr, which is also pointing to the same
102 // RefCountedObject as buffer, increasing ref count.
103 return rtc::scoped_refptr<I420Buffer>(raw_buffer);
104 }
105
106 if (buffers_.size() >= max_number_of_buffers_)
107 return nullptr;
108 // Allocate new buffer.
109 rtc::scoped_refptr<I420Buffer> buffer =
110 rtc::make_ref_counted<I420Buffer>(width, height);
111
112 if (zero_initialize_)
113 buffer->InitializeData();
114
115 buffers_.push_back(buffer);
116 return buffer;
117}
118
119rtc::scoped_refptr<NV12Buffer> VideoFrameBufferPool::CreateNV12Buffer(
120 int width,
121 int height) {
122 RTC_DCHECK_RUNS_SERIALIZED(&race_checker_);
123
124 rtc::scoped_refptr<VideoFrameBuffer> existing_buffer =
125 GetExistingBuffer(width, height, VideoFrameBuffer::Type::kNV12);
126 if (existing_buffer) {
127 // Cast is safe because the only way kI420 buffer is created is
128 // in the same function below, where |RefCountedObject<I420Buffer>| is
129 // created.
130 rtc::RefCountedObject<NV12Buffer>* raw_buffer =
131 static_cast<rtc::RefCountedObject<NV12Buffer>*>(existing_buffer.get());
132 // Creates a new scoped_refptr, which is also pointing to the same
133 // RefCountedObject as buffer, increasing ref count.
134 return rtc::scoped_refptr<NV12Buffer>(raw_buffer);
135 }
136
137 if (buffers_.size() >= max_number_of_buffers_)
138 return nullptr;
139 // Allocate new buffer.
140 rtc::scoped_refptr<NV12Buffer> buffer =
141 rtc::make_ref_counted<NV12Buffer>(width, height);
142
143 if (zero_initialize_)
144 buffer->InitializeData();
145
146 buffers_.push_back(buffer);
147 return buffer;
148}
149
150rtc::scoped_refptr<VideoFrameBuffer> VideoFrameBufferPool::GetExistingBuffer(
151 int width,
152 int height,
153 VideoFrameBuffer::Type type) {
154 // Release buffers with wrong resolution or different type.
155 for (auto it = buffers_.begin(); it != buffers_.end();) {
156 const auto& buffer = *it;
157 if (buffer->width() != width || buffer->height() != height ||
158 buffer->type() != type) {
159 it = buffers_.erase(it);
160 } else {
161 ++it;
162 }
163 }
164 // Look for a free buffer.
165 for (const rtc::scoped_refptr<VideoFrameBuffer>& buffer : buffers_) {
166 // If the buffer is in use, the ref count will be >= 2, one from the list we
167 // are looping over and one from the application. If the ref count is 1,
168 // then the list we are looping over holds the only reference and it's safe
169 // to reuse.
170 if (HasOneRef(buffer)) {
171 RTC_CHECK(buffer->type() == type);
172 return buffer;
173 }
174 }
175 return nullptr;
176}
177
178} // namespace webrtc
